extendedIngredients.name: apple
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ medium apple, peeled and cut in ¼-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: golden berries
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ cups dried golden berries (or raisins or dried cranberries)

extendedIngredients.name: walnuts
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup toasted chopped walnuts (pecans, hazelnuts, almonds or cashews work, too)
metaInformation: (pecans, hazelnuts, almonds or cashews work, too)

recipes.title: Massaged Kale Superfood Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Salad works really well with Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. The Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: Massage kale using the method of your choice.Sprinkle in the chopped apples, dried fruit, nuts and seeds. Drizzle with salad dressing. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

steps.step: Massage kale using the method of your choice.Sprinkle in the chopped apples, dried fruit, nuts and seeds.
Drizzle with salad dressing. Toss to combine.
